data.title: A Must-See in Little Rock
data.text: We enjoyed exploring the state capitol building on a Sunday afternoon in November.  It is a beautiful building!  Although some of the areas were not open, we enjoyed the quiet visit.  It is definitely worth your time.

data.title: Beautiful
data.text: Whenever we visit a state we try to see the capitol. This is a gorgeous building. The dome can be seen from the highway but get off the road so you can also see the beautiful grounds. It's a very striking building and one of the best we've seen.

data.title: Nice grounds!
data.text: Visited the outside only on a Sunday afternoon, and downtown was absolutely deserted.  Enjoyed a nice walk around the grounds taking in all the sculpture and history.

data.title: Among the best capitols we've visite
data.text: My wife's bucket list includes visiting all 50 state capitol buildings. This is #17 and is one of the top two "most friendly" on our list. The grounds are immaculate and the building, in spite of the repair on the facades presently underway, is beautiful. Displays throughout the building are clear and informative.

data.title: Brilliant visit
data.text: Beautiful building, just walked around at our own pace and visited the The Treasury, where we allowed to hold $350,000 in notes and had a photo taken. The young man who showed us around the Treasury was very knowledgeable and took time to us how the huge vault worked. Very interesting visit.

data.title: Legislature in Session Visit
data.text: I always enjoy visiting the State Capitol. I don't always enjoy the issues which bring me there, however the State Capitol and the Grounds surrounding it are always impeccably maintained. Arkansas' State Capitol is actually a very beautiful building & the people of Arkansas have something to proud of in their Capitol.

data.title: Interesting Visit.
data.text: The grounds and interior are very well kept. There are a lot of fascinating things going on at the state capitol. I recommend downloading, or at least viewing, the online resources and maps beforehand to give you an idea of what/where to go.

data.title: Excellent Tour Guide
data.text: One of the most beautiful capitols we've visited! We've visited over half of the capitols and would rate in top three. Tour guide was excellent.

data.title: Historic Beauty
data.text: The Arkansas State Capitol is a wonderfuly designed building that brings the old and new together seamlessly.  From the bronze doorways, marble floors and stairwells to the gorgeous chandiller hanging in the rotunda you will be visually delighted.  Throughout the Capitol you will find a pictorial depiction of the history of Arkansas.  If you visit during the Winter Holiday season you will be overwhelmed with the beautiful decorations with several photo ops.  If you are forutnate to be in attendance when the various muscial guest are performing you will be amazed at the accoustics of our delightful rotunda.  I highly recommend touring the Arkansas State Capitol.

data.title: great, free tour
data.text: We enjoyed our free tour of the capitol building. The architecture and the tour guides were wonderful.  A highlight for us was the treasury room, where we were allowed to enter the vault and hold $360,000 in our hands.  Super cool!

data.title: Should Be on Everyone's Bucket List
data.text: You never know exactly what you're going see at the State Capitol. But seeing democracy in action and sitting in the upper viewing areas to watch and listen to the senate or house deliberating is really a cool experience ~ from elementary age to adults.

data.title: A nice place to visit
data.text: The architecture is very pretty and the Capitol Park is nice as well. Probably worth a 1 - 2 hours visit, maybe a bit more if one is interested in lots of details about state's history (see exhibitions on the top floors).

data.title: Great Tour
data.text: Had a great tour and guide was very knowledgable, friendly and had a good sense of humor.  Would recommend having enough time to visit the Treasury too...we did not.  Parking is not good so be prepared.

data.title: Capitol of Little Rock
data.text: When you drive into view of this beautiful historic building, you see nothing but what Arkansas represents....freedom, family and home.  The grounds, the monuments the trees all represent the people of Arkansas with such grand order...The inside is more amazing, the tundra is an echo of all the many voices and those who have past through those copper doors at the top of the steps.  It is quite a view, looking down Capitol Avenue...It is a must see for sure when you visit Arkansas.

data.title: An Attractive and Imposing Structure
data.text:
I have always seen the top of the dome of the state capitol when I would visit Little Rock in the past, but never made it to the building until September, 2016.

My wife and I drove out to its ideal location on a Sunday afternoon after church. There were actually plenty of parking spaces available which is a good reason to go on the weekend. Of course not everything was open (the gift shop is closed) but we were able to see enough to impress us significantly.

First of all, you need to visit the monuments and statues on the vast lawn (very impressive). The landscaping is very well done, and the building itself, modeled after the U. S. Capitol  Building, is stately and imposing.

If you drive around you will find various state office buildings and notice the designated parking spaces of several important state office holders.

The key to the success of the state capitol is its ideal location. It is away from the downtown area center in a place not completely level (semi-rolling and mildly hilly). It is peaceful, at least on a weekend, and beautifully planned and designed (let's hear it for the architects and builders).

Go see the area for yourself and see if you don't conclude that this is one of the most attractive state capitol buildings in America.

J. Randolph Smith
Monroe, LA

data.title: Trip to Little Rock and State Capital
data.text: A very opulent building, a lot of white marble everywhere. It was not in session so we had a free run of the place.

data.title: Vacation
data.text: I enjoyed walking the grounds of the Capital of Arkansas. It had several statures of Veterans honored for bravery.

data.title: Impressive a must see!
data.text: The grounds are impressive and the building is aw inspiring. If you are in Little Rock make the effort to visit and you will have great photo op moments.

data.title: One of the least attractive tours
data.text: We missed the guided tour as one doesn't occur at noon. The self guided tour is ok, but there is a lack of history about the various branches that meet here. It was disappointing that the customer service agents did not know the meaning of their state flag and seal. There is not much history displayed here, only a few showcases.

data.title: Very Interesting!!
data.text:
If you like anything about buildings this is a for sure place to check out!! It is a beautiful structure! If possible visit at Christmas. Decorated very nicely.

 It cost 2.2 million to build. Completed in 1915. Would cost approx. 350 million to build today!! Very extravagant.
